subject: Re: WEB Project moving foreward
msgSnippet: Just a note for anyone who is interested: the Gospel according to Mark is up and ready for download. If anyone wants the source files, those can be made
messageBody:
Just a note for anyone who is interested: the Gospel according to Mark is up and ready for download. If anyone wants the source files, those can be made available too :)

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Timothy" <tim_rice09@...> wrote:
>
> Thank you. The lines could use a bit more spacing. As for half letters, the project is using the Private-Use area encoding for easier conversion when QS makes it into Unicode proper. Once this project is done, I hope to begin work on an edition in Senior QS.
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Paige Gabhart <pgabhart@> wrote:
> >
> > I have been reading the book of Philemon. My only suggestion so far
> > would be to space the lines slightly farther apart to avoid tall letters
> > from clashing with deep letters on the line above. It should not take
> > much of an increase in spacing.
> >
> > I think it is an interesting project. As you said, it is a best
> > seller. A person learning English as a second language and wanting to
> > improve their knowledge of English syntax and grammar for speaking
> > purposes might be interested in reading a script that is phonemic and
> > faster to learn than T.O.
> >
> > Paige
> >
> > P.S. I still think that the use of a font that permits half-letters
> > would be more distinctive and easier to read fluently. There is nothing
> > that mandates the use of junior quikscript in printed texts or suggests
> > that the half-letters should be relegated to handwritten texts.
> >
> > On 4/4/2012 10:48 AM, Timothy wrote:
> > >
> > > It's hard to say what dialect it's in exactly. It should be completely
> > > readable to any English speaker, and if not, that's why collaborating
> > > is such a good idea. The book of Philemon is finished and available
> > > from the project site if you want to see how things look so far :)
> > >
> > > --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
> > > <mailto:Read_Alphabet%40yahoogroups.com>, Michael Everson
> > > <everson@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > I'm looking for the final text of Alice, since I guess I've had all
> > > the comments I can expect on the fonts. Was it ever prepared? And is
> > > it in British English? ;-)
> > > >
> > > > On 3 Apr 2012, at 00:47, Timothy wrote:
> > > >
> > > > > After much delay and technical hurdles, getting the WEB
> > > translation of the Bible into Quikscript is finally getting on its
> > > way. The work is being hosted on Sourceforge and anyone who is
> > > interested in helping is more than welcome to help. The tool that's
> > > been selected to finish out the project is Bibledit, which works
> > > perfectly on any Debian-based Linux and, according to the developer,
> > > on Windows and OSX.
> > > > >
> > > > > Every word will have to be checked, which is probably a good
> > > thing. Let's get the world's bestseller into this awesome alphabet,
> > > and go from there.
> > > > >
> > > > > http://sourceforge.net/projects/web-qs/
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > >
> > > > Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com/
> > > >
> > >
> > >
> >
>
